props.synopsis: The AFP Victim Identification Team are often parents themselves, tasked with solving some of the most grim and shocking crimes humans commit. For them, disconnecting from work is a necessity.

title.children: Inside the police unit unmasking child predators

image.altText: a bishop at an assyrian orthodox church during a service before a person approaches and allegedley stabs him

props.synopsis: The teenager who allegedly attacked a bishop at a church in Sydney was placed on a good behaviour bond after being convicted of a knife crime three months ago, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Teenager accused of church attack received good behaviour bond for knife crime

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee leaned in to the Shakespearean tragedy of Bruce Lehrmann's case and with the narrative muscularity of a literary thriller showed simplicity and complexity need not be enemies. As his judgment took form it became clear he had an altogether more useful verdict in mind.

title.children: The public battle between 'Team Higgins' and 'Team Lehrmann' revealed tribalism's most frightening trap

image.altText: Julian Assange looks to the camera as he is photographed from behind glass with graffiti etched into it. His grey hair is back.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange's bid to avoid extradition to America is dealt a blow, as lawyers for the United States provide the assurances about his treatment that a London court had demanded.

title.children: Assange's family in 'extreme distress' as US responds to UK court's extradition demands

image.altText: Three young women walk with suitcases at Sydney's Circular Quay

props.synopsis: The return of international tourists to Australia appears to be stalling, with numbers almost 30 per cent down on 2019. So how do we get them back?

title.children: Four years after COVID shuttered borders, where the bloody hell are the international tourists?

image.altText: people wearing masks stand in a queue along a fenceline

props.synopsis: A research team uses a computer simulation to predict what the death toll would have been among older Australians without any vaccine campaign at all.

title.children: Australia's vaccine campaign likely prevented almost 18,000 COVID-19 deaths in NSW, new report says

image.altText: The High Court on the shores of Lake Burley Griffin. There are dark clouds over the building, and a seagull in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for an Iranian man refusing to cooperate with efforts to deport him will make their arguments before the High Court today, demanding his release to the community.

title.children: The High Court will today hear a case of a migrant resisting deportation, which could have far-reaching implications

image.altText: donkey on conveyor belt

props.synopsis: A live toad, holy water from the Ganges and an aphrodisiac made from donkeys are among the more unusual items detected at Australian airports and mail centres.

title.children: The unusual detections caught coming into Australia

image.altText: A man with a helmet on is standing inside a processing plant.

props.synopsis: Critical minerals projects in Queensland and South Australia will receive hundreds of millions of dollars in federal government loans as part of the government's plan for a "future made in Australia".

title.children: Critical minerals projects to receive $585 million in federal government loans

image.altText: Colourful squares and decorations on tables beside beige curtains in a room with plenty of natural light.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of a 53-year-old Victorian woman who fell ill after consuming a drink at a retreat in the regional town of Clunes, north of Ballarat.

title.children: Police investigate death of woman who fell ill after consuming drink at Victorian wellness retreat

image.altText: Bruce looks serious as he walks through a throng of reporters, wearing suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Now might be a good time to reflect on how devotedly and brutally mastheads and prominent commentators seek to undermine, discredit and destroy women who allege sexual assault, or report on it.

title.children: How rape can be turned into a culture war boggles the mind. But this case was politicised at the starting gate

image.altText: A man wearing a Woolworths polo shirt with the name tag 'Brad' stands in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: Woolworths boss Brad Banducci was warned he could face six months in prison or a $5,000 fine if he was held in contempt by the Senate for failing to answer questions at the inquiry into supermarket pricing.

title.children: Greens senator threatens Woolworths CEO with six months in prison for contempt of Senate

image.altText: A man at the top of an escalator holds a bollard, to holds back a man with a knife

props.synopsis: A petition was set up by a member of the public calling for him to be granted an Australian citizenship, describing his actions as a "true act of Australianism".

title.children: Bondi attack 'bollard man' to be granted permanent residency in Australia, lawyer says

image.altText: Former Rebel bikie president Nick Martin pictured with a woman whose face is blurred.

props.synopsis: The assassination of bikie boss Nick Martin happened just months after he was asked to step aside over fears he was stealing club money to fund a lavish home renovation, a Perth court has heard.

title.children: Assassinated bikie boss Nick Martin stole club money to fund lavish home renovation, court hears

image.altText: A composite image of Mark Haines with railway tracks.

props.synopsis: An inquest into the 1988 death of Mark Anthony Haines hears that on the morning the Gomeroi teenager's body was discovered, one of his friends spoke of being in an accident and said that Mark was dead.

title.children: Mark Haines inquest hears friend told another man 'I think I killed him' on morning body found

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a cap and puffer jacket walks next to a journalist outside a police station.

props.synopsis: Ex-Test cricketer and TV commentator Michael Slater falls to the floor as he is denied bail over allegations he stalked and assaulted a woman this year.

title.children: Michael Slater collapses in court as bail denied after stalking, assault charges

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Legal experts are calling for reform of Australia's defamation laws to better protect survivors, journalists, and media publishers producing stories about violence against women, in the wake of Bruce Lehrmann's defeat in the Federal Court.

title.children: Calls for 'trauma-informed approach' to sexual abuse judgments in wake of Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation trial

image.altText: Fire and smoke rise out of the Old Stock Exchange's spire.

props.synopsis: A fire has broken out at Copenhagen's Old Stock Exchange, one of the Danish capital's best-known buildings, engulfing its spire which collapsed onto the roof in a scene reminiscent of the 2019 blaze at Paris's Notre-Dame cathedral.

title.children: 'Our Notre Dame moment': Spire collapses as fire rages at Copenhagen's historic stock exchange

image.altText: Charlie Cameron pictured against Melbourne

props.synopsis: Charlie Cameron is free to face Geelong this week after the tribunal overturned his one-match ban. The reason for their decision was one that is rarely seen.

title.children: 'Exceptional and compelling circumstances' see Cameron freed at tribunal

image.altText: A crowd of people bathed in red light stand in a street at night.

props.synopsis: Emergency responders were confronted with "terrifying and extremely violent" scenes after a bishop was stabbed during a church service. Paramedics had to hide in the church after coming under threat.

title.children: Paramedics hid for over three hours in fear for their lives after Sydney church stabbing

image.altText: A paramedic rolls a stretcher towards a church while a crowd stand outside.

props.synopsis: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel was live streaming from his western Sydney church on Monday night when he was approached by a teenager.

title.children: How a terror attack on a Sydney bishop and his followers unfolded online

image.altText: An old man in church robes inside a church.

props.synopsis: A charismatic and controversial figure, he gained a significant online following during 2020 as an outspoken opponent of COVID-19 lockdowns and has given sermons criticising non-Christian religions.

title.children: What we know about the bishop attacked at his Sydney church

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek and  Senator Sarah Hanson-Young arrive to speak during a presser.

props.synopsis: Plans for a new national environmental protection body have been revealed, but broader reform of the nation's environmental laws has been deferred indefinitely.

title.children: New environmental enforcer on the way, but little progress on promised overhaul of environment laws

image.altText: A white ceiling fan with three blades, which are coated in dust.

props.synopsis: For appliances that spend a lot of their time moving, ceiling fans have a tendency to gather a surprising amount of dust. What are the most effective ways to clean them?

title.children: The important step to take before wiping down your ceiling fans

image.altText: A close up of a teaspoon of bright yellow ground turmeric.

props.synopsis: About 80 per cent of the crop is grown in India, but Australian farmers have now invested in its growth as its popularity rises due to its health benefits and culinary uses.

title.children: Mostly grown in monsoonal forests, turmeric's been found to thrive in our driest state, fetching up to $60/kg

image.altText: People in swimming gear standing on the edge of a sinkhole full of water.

props.synopsis: Little Blue Lake attracts thousands of tourists and cave divers from across the globe, but has no toilet facilities. Appalled residents say it's high time something is done to prevent people from relieving themselves in the water and car park at the site.

title.children: Anger and disgust as human poo piles up in and around iconic SA swimming hole

image.altText: Wayne Irving smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Wayne Irving, 67, was brought by ambulance to Ipswich Hospital with abdominal pain in November last year. Four hours later he was pronounced dead.

title.children: Queensland man who spent three hours ramped in an ambulance unlikely to have survived if seen sooner, report finds

image.altText: Mike Burgess, Reece Kershaw and Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Authorities investigating a stabbing incident at a Sydney church explain why it is being treated as an alleged terrorist attack, while Saturday's stabbing rampage at Bondi Junction was not.

title.children: What constitutes a terrorist attack? And what is Australia's current terror threat level?

image.altText: A QantasLink Boeng 717-200 plane flies on a blue sky backdrop

props.synopsis: A transport safety report reveals how a pilot and first officer suffered hypoxia-like symptoms following a chlorine-like smell in the cabin of a Sydney to Hobart passenger flight last year.

title.children: QantasLink pilots suffered dizziness, vision problems while attempting to land, but they didn't use oxygen masks

image.altText: Kelly Slater looks emotional while speaking to a World Surf League interviewer.

props.synopsis: Surfing legend Kelly Slater holds back tears as his career effectively ends at Western Australia's Margaret River Pro, although the 11-time world champion is hoping for one last wildcard in Fiji.

title.children: Kelly Slater holds back tears as he talks about the end of his legendary surfing career at Margaret River

image.altText: Mia and Eliza are standing with arms around each other, grafitti in background with posters glued to the wall

props.synopsis: After enduring countless sexist insults, 15-year-old Mia Murphy and her friend decided to call out the haters in a creative way, in Melbourne's Hosier Lane.

title.children: When Mia's school failed to punish her bullies, she took matters into her own hands

image.altText: Danielle Laidley in a animal print shirt, speaking to the media from behind a podium.

props.synopsis: Western Australians will no longer have to undergo medical or surgical reassignment in order to change their sex or gender, under the state government's proposed law reforms.

title.children: Gender reassignment reforms to bring WA 'out of the dark ages', state government says

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a bench and looks at the camera. He is frowning.

props.synopsis: For the next six weeks or so, a courtroom on the 15th floor of the New York County Supreme Court will be the setting for a trial that made history before it even started. And once again, Donald Trump is at the centre of unprecedented events.

title.children: 'I just couldn't do it': The difficulties of finding a jury for Trump's first criminal trial

image.altText: A city late at night with three streaks of light going up in the air.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of drones and missiles were launched towards Israel in an Iranian attack analysts say was unlike anything the world had seen. This is how Israel was able to thwart the five-hour onslaught.

title.children: Could any other country withstand a strike like Iran's? Why the onslaught on Israel is a future war wake-up call
